text: Donald Cochrane (27 May 1917 – 31 March 1983) was an Australian econometrician. He was a long-time faculty member at the University of Melbourne, and is known for developing the Cochrane–Orcutt estimation procedure. A native of Melbourne, Cochrane graduated from the University of Melbourne in 1945, after serving in the Royal Australian Air Force during World War II. He continued his studies at Clare College, Cambridge, earning a doctorate under supervision of Richard Stone. == References == Category:1917 births Category:1983 deaths Category:Australian economists Category:Time series econometricians Category:University of Melbourne alumni Category:Alumni of Clare College, Cambridge Category:University of Melbourne faculty Category:Royal Australian Air Force personnel Category:20th-century Australian mathematicians Category:20th-century economists
title: Donald Cochrane (economist)
